title: (x) Goldfrapp logo - custom designed {Andrew J Sipe}
content:
Hi guys,  
Need some help here..  
I need to figure out which font was used as a base for the goldfrapp logo.. Im pretty sure the designer based the logo on a existing font.. Anyone who can help me out?

thank you very much...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113044353im_/http:/typophile.com/files/goldfrapp_3980.jpg)
author: markuskarlsson

comments.content:
I don't think this was based on a pre-existing font. The p's are just inverted d's. The line weight and end strokes are inconsistent. The G is just horribly outlined, and really bumpy. I think the l was flipped for some reason. The stroke on the o is as thick as the G.

If it was based on a font, it was then horribly mangled into what we see today.

I would believe that it was hand done and then scanned digitally.

For something similar, you might want to check : [http://www.sudtipos.com/home](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113044353/http:/www.sudtipos.com/home "http://www.sudtipos.com/home")
what do you mean ask someone at work?

Hmmm... According to this message board, the Goldfrapp logo is not based on an existing typeface:

[http://www.goldfrapp.co.uk/msgboard/showthread.php?t=8663](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113044353/http:/www.goldfrapp.co.uk/msgboard/showthread.php?t=8663 "http://www.goldfrapp.co.uk/msgboard/showthread.php?t=8663")

@markuskarlsson

if you're the owner of markusskarlsson.com, you work at big active, and i thought this (goldfrapp) was a big active job?
haha ok.. yeah that's me.. but we didn't do the very very first version of the logo..

What about Alison Goldfrapp? She is credited as the designer of the [**Felt Mountain**](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113044353/http:/www.amazon.com/Felt-Mountain-Goldfrapp/dp/B00004XSS2) artwork, no?
